geneVariantDescriptions.description: PTEN H93R lies within the phosphatase tensin-type domain of the Pten protein (UniProt.org). The functional effect of H93R is conflicting, as it demonstrates phosphatase activity similar to wild-type Pten in yeast (PMID: 21828076), but results in reduced catalytic activity in vitro (PMID: 25647146), decreased suppression of TH (PMID: 26579216), increased binding affinity to PS (PMID: 22505997), and demonstrates reduced ability to dephosphorylate PIP3 in culture and is not able to rescue neuronal hypertrophy and pS6 signaling in PTEN-null animal models (PMID: 29373119), and therefore, its effect on Pten protein function is unknown.
